LanguageData.Chinchilla.label: chinchilla
LanguageData.Chinchilla.description: A small, nimble rodent. Its fur is softer than just about anything in the universe, making it very valuable as a trade good.
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.left_claw.label: left claw
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.right_claw.label: right claw
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Deer.label: deer
LanguageData.Deer.description: A medium-sized herding herbivore which prefers to live in mixed forests and plains. Deer are very quick.
LanguageData.Deer.tools.left_hoof.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Deer.tools.right_hoof.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Deer.tools.teeth.label: teeth
LanguageData.Deer.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Gazelle.label: gazelle
LanguageData.Gazelle.description: A small, extremely quick antelope known for its amazingly long leap.
LanguageData.Gazelle.tools.left_hoof.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Gazelle.tools.right_hoof.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Gazelle.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Ibex.label: ibex
LanguageData.Ibex.description: The wild ancestor of the domesticated goat. Ibexes live on marginal territory where most antelopes couldn't survive, eating lichens and sparse mountain plants. They're famous for dextrously hopping across bare cliff faces - and for their violent ramming attack.
LanguageData.Ibex.tools.left_hoof.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Ibex.tools.right_hoof.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Ibex.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Pig.label: pig
LanguageData.Pig.description: Pigs were one of the first animals domesticated by humans. They are an efficient source of meat, and are easy to feed because they will eat almost anything.
LanguageData.Pig.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.WildBoar.label: wild boar
LanguageData.WildBoar.description: This hairy omnivore is descended from escaped pigs and evolved for living in the wild.\n\nIts tusks make it a better fighter than its domesticated pig cousins. Unfortunately, it is too unruly to be trained in the most complex tasks.
LanguageData.WildBoar.tools.tusk.label: tusk
LanguageData.WildBoar.tools.head.label: head
